author: funnygiulio
content: Made a counter EIP to <@316280621783580673> https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8933

author: funnygiulio
content: here I propose instead to determine a fixed rate per block of increase in the gas limit until a specific block is reached (kind of like the difficulty bomb)

author: funnygiulio
content: this makes the gas limit controlled at the consensus level (el side) instead than governance based. Here - I suggest to target 60mn gas limit within 2 years. this will allow us to re-evaluate the increase in gas limit at any given point

author: funnygiulio
content: if 60mn is too much and 40mn is better - during a successive hard fork we can change the de-activation block

author: funnygiulio
content: this is a slower and more predictable approach - I believe

author: funnygiulio
content: I took inspiration from <@206016661470314496> saying that an increase is due but needs to be done regularly - this EIP adds a gradual framework for that

author: funnygiulio
content: and removes  the whole "cliff" increase within the client's default

author: jochembrouwer
content: I left a review. Personally I would not remove the gas limit adjustments based on governance because this gives us flexibility to decrease (and also increase) the gas limit if we find a problem. The EIP removes this flexibility, which could be problematic if we find a new DoS vector which means we have to decrease the gas limit until we fork out the problem. (And also for increase, if at some point we want to increase "faster" then this is now also not possible)

author: funnygiulio
content:
so in reality you can just change the heurstic on how the gas limit is set by validators to the following function:

```
F(Block_Num) = Block_Num + (rate_of_increase) * (BlockNUM - Start_Block_Num)
```

author: funnygiulio
